carousel_items: Take Fosamax first thing in the morning with a full glass of water before eating or drinking anything else, including other medicines.
The pill must be swallowed whole.
Stay upright for at least 30 minutes after taking the medicine, and don't eat or drink anything except plain water during that time.
Make sure you take enough calcium and vitamin D to allow this medicine to work.
Can cause an upset stomach, joint pain, back pain, or heartburn.
Stop taking the medicine and let your doctor know if swallowing becomes painful, if you have chest pain, or if any of the side effects worsen.
If you have dental work coming up, get it done before starting this medicine since some people have experienced serious jaw problems while on Fosamax.

clock.tip: Works more slowly when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Fosamax is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Fosamax is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but taking it can be a hassle.
downsides: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

upsides: Lowers your risk of bone fractures.
Available in two forms: one that can be taken once a day or another that's taken once a week.
Comes as a regular tablet, an oral solution, or effervescent tablets meant to be dissolved in water.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers your risk of bone fractures.
Available in two forms: one that can be taken once a day or another that's taken once a week.
Comes as a regular tablet, an oral solution, or effervescent tablets meant to be dissolved in water.

userStories.identifier: On disability due to a neck injury.
userStories.tip: Must take on an empty stomach, first thing in am, with a full glass of water (only water). Must stay upright (either standing or sitting up) for at least a half hour. May cause esophagus irritation or ulcers. May cause reflux.

userStories.identifier: Used to be a very active senior.
userStories.tip: DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG! I was on it for 10 yrs when my right femur broke while taking a simple walk. Xrays showed that my left femur had a hairline facture and would break eventually, so I now have rods in both legs and never without pain.
I wish I had known about the effects on the jaw bone (osteonecrosis)

drugs.name: Fosamax

condition_url_name: Bone loss in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Fosamax first thing in the morning with a full glass of water before eating or drinking anything else, including other medicines.
The pill must be swallowed whole.
Stay upright for at least 30 minutes after taking the medicine, and don't eat or drink anything except plain water during that time.
Make sure you take enough calcium and vitamin D to allow this medicine to work.
Can cause an upset stomach, joint pain, back pain, or heartburn.
Stop taking the medicine and let your doctor know if swallowing becomes painful, if you have chest pain, or if any of the side effects worsen.
If you have dental work coming up, get it done before starting this medicine since some people have experienced serious jaw problems while on Fosamax.

risks_warnings.title: Irritation and ulcers to the stomach and esophagus
risks_warnings.description: People on Fosamax have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

description_processed.orig: People on Fosamax have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Fosamax have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Fosamax have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Fosamax have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Fosamax.

description_processed.orig: People on Fosamax have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Fosamax.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: People on Fosamax have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People on Fosamax have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: People on Fosamax who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication, since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor,

description_processed.orig: People on Fosamax who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication, since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor,
